<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 280, 170, 291]]<|/det|> **PHYSICS** <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 301, 235, 312]]<|/det|> Paper 3 Extended <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 341, 415, 353]]<|/det|> Candidates answer on the Question Paper. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 361, 368, 372]]<|/det|> No Additional Materials are required. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 394, 386, 405]]<|/det|> **READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST** <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 420, 718, 432]]<|/det|> Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 325, 446]]<|/det|> Write in dark blue or black pen. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 449, 462, 461]]<|/det|> You may use a pencil for any diagrams or graphs. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 463, 598, 475]]<|/det|> Do not use staples, paper clips, highlighters, glue or correction fluid. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 477, 384, 488]]<|/det|> DO **NOT** WRITE IN ANY BARCODES. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 503, 255, 514]]<|/det|> Answer **all** questions. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 517, 632, 543]]<|/det|> You may lose marks if you do not show your working or if you do not use appropriate units. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 545, 636, 557]]<|/det|> Take the weight of 1kg to be 10N (i.e. acceleration of free fall \(=10m/s^{2}\) ). <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 571, 603, 583]]<|/det|> At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 585, 652, 611]]<|/det|> The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question. <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[710, 485, 905, 850]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 73, 808, 107]]<|/det|>
A bucket is full of oil. The total mass of the bucket of oil is \(5.4 \text{kg}\) and the gravitation strength is \(10 \text{N/kg}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 120, 146, 138]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 120, 527, 138]]<|/det|>
Calculate the total weight of the bucket of oil.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[510, 180, 875, 199]]<|/det|>
<form>weight = ............................................................ [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 211, 148, 230]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 211, 875, 244]]<|/det|>
The bucket of oil is hung from a spring of unstretched length \(20 \text{cm}\). The limit of proportionality of the spring is not exceeded and its length increases to \(35 \text{cm}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 259, 180, 276]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 259, 601, 276]]<|/det|>
State what is meant by the limit of proportionality.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[196, 292, 875, 310]]<|/det|>
......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[196, 320, 875, 337]]<|/det|>
......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 351, 181, 370]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 351, 875, 384]]<|/det|>
The oil is poured into a measuring tank. The empty bucket stretches the spring to a length of \(25 \text{cm}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 397, 277, 415]]<|/det|>
Calculate

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 429, 680, 447]]<|/det|>
1. the force that stretches the spring to a length of \(25 \text{cm}\),

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[524, 536, 875, 555]]<|/det|>
<form>force = ......................................................... [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 568, 576, 586]]<|/det|>
2. the mass of the oil in the measuring tank.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[520, 644, 875, 662]]<|/det|>
<form>mass = ......................................................... [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 675, 183, 694]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 675, 875, 708]]<|/det|>
The volume of the oil in the measuring tank is \(0.0045 \text{m}^3\). Calculate the density of the oil.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[505, 784, 875, 802]]<|/det|>
<form>density = ......................................................... [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 816, 146, 834]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 816, 870, 834]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[789, 887, 876, 906]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 823, 107]]<|/det|>
A diver is at a depth of \(25 \text{m}\) beneath the surface of a lake. He carries a cylinder high-pressure air on his back.

<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 120, 876, 138]]<|/det|>

<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 272, 180, 291]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 444, 692, 462]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 73, 821, 107]]<|/det|>
The water in a copper hot-water tank is heated during the night. During the day, the cools as thermal energy (heat) passes from the water to the air surrounding the tank.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 831, 120]]<|/det|>
A very sensitive, centre-zero voltmeter is connected to the two terminals of a solenoid. Fig. 9.1 shows the S pole of a cylindrical magnet being inserted into the solenoid.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[190, 138, 755, 295]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[460, 304, 635, 330]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 348, 873, 383]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 396, 673, 415]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 488, 180, 507]]<|/det|>

<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 73, 833, 120]]<|/det|>

<mark>[1]

<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 444, 475, 463]]<|/det|>

<mark>[4]

<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 73, 702, 92]]<|/det|>
The isotope thorium-234 is radioactive. It emits \(\beta\) -particles as it decays.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 104, 146, 122]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 104, 850, 136]]<|/det|>
The incomplete nuclide equation represents the decay of thorium-234 to an isotope protactinium (Pa).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 150, 352, 166]]<|/det|>
Complete the equation.

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[344, 177, 611, 210]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{234}{90}\mathrm{Th}\longrightarrow \xrightarrow{\mathrm{......}}\mathrm{Pa} + \xrightarrow{\mathrm{......}}\beta\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[848, 202, 876, 219]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 231, 146, 249]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 231, 875, 263]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[265, 280, 680, 411]]<|/det|>
<center>Fig. 11.1 </center>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 466, 875, 498]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 505, 562, 523]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[800, 597, 875, 615]]<|/det|>
